intro: Flacourtia flexuosa, commonly known as the warty-flowered flacourtia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rough, branched stems and clusters of small, warty flowers. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape and have a slightly hairy surface. Flacourtia flexuosa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
